pr_title: Filter participations without submissions + add submission count to participations

timeline.message: Add participation filter for participations without submissions + add submission count column to participations table
Center align head cells for submissionCount + specify width on columns for participations data table
Get rid of very expensive query

timeline.bodyText: Can you use primitive types here for returned result and parameter? https://crunchify.com/java-tip-wherever-possible-try-to-use-primitive-types-instead-of-wrapper-classes/
timeline.author: maxr96

timeline.bodyText: This can also be a primitive type. The count should not be a null value, right?
timeline.author: maxr96

replies.bodyText: It will always be an actual int value. I switched it.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: I think this can be easier using .stream(toMap({})).
timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: Thanks, that does make it much shorter!
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @return the number of submissions per participation
          
          
            
                 * @return Tuples of participation ids and number of submissions per participation
timeline.author: jpbernius

timeline.bodyText: This got refactored from Result. Should we also update toString?
timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: I added it to the toString method.
replies.author: madwau

replies.bodyText: Please use Integer, because this value might not be initialized
replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: Can you also change this Long exerciseId one to primitive type please?
timeline.author: maxr96

timeline.message: Add submissionCount to toString for Participation
Fix sorting by submission count in exercise scores

timeline.bodyText:
please use a better variable name than t and add one natural language comment before such asa
convert the list of arrays (with 2 values: participatoinId, submissionCount) into a Map <participationIid -> submissionCount>
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
I decided to name it participationIdAndSubmissionCountPair instead of t and added the following comment:
// convert List<[participationId, submissionCount]> into Map<participationId -> submissionCount>
replies.author: madwau

timeline.message: Use Integer instead of int for submissionCount (to be able to differentiate between zero and null where null means that the submission count is not available, i.e. has not been computed and set)
